mvc

Class ShareoData

  • java.lang.Object
    • mvc.ShareoData

  • public class ShareoData
extends java.lang.Object

    This class is intended as an interaction between a database and an application. The database stores Users, Things, and Bids. In order to keep the database in order, some care must be taken when adding data. For example, when adding a User, all the Things that it owns will not be added automatically.

    Modification of Things and Users can occur outside this object, but to update the database with the changes, the update methods of this object must be used.

    One can also remove objects from the database, in a very similar manner to updating them.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ShareoData getInstance()

      • addUser

        public void addUser(User user)
             throws UsernameAlreadyExistsException
        Add a new User to the database. If a user already exists with the same name, the call will fail. This only adds a user to the database, meaning any things that are owned by it must also be added, separately, using addGame(Thing). The same goes for any bids placed by the user, using addBid(Bid). The user's id will be its username.
        Parameters:
        user - User to add to the database.
        Throws:
        UsernameAlreadyExistsException - A user with the same name already exists.
        See Also:
        removeUser(User), updateUser(User), getUser(String), addGame(Thing), addBid(Bid)

      • addGame

        public void addGame(Thing thing)
        Add a new Thing to the database. This only adds the thing to the database, meaning that the owner, borrower, and bids must be added separately.
        Parameters:
        thing - Thing to add to the database.
        See Also:
        removeGame(Thing), updateGame(Thing), getGame(String), addUser(User), addBid(Bid)

      • addBid

        public void addBid(Bid bid)
        Add a new Bid to the database. This only adds the bid to the database, meaning that the bidder and biddee must be added separately.
        Parameters:
        bid - Bid to add to the database.
        See Also:
        removeBid(Bid), addUser(User), addGame(Thing)

      • getUser

        public User getUser(java.lang.String name)
        Get the User with the specified username. Returns null if this user does not exist.
        Parameters:
        name - username of the user.
        Returns:
        The user object.
        See Also:
        addUser(User), removeUser(User), updateUser(User)

      • getGamesByDescription

        public java.util.List<Thing> getGamesByDescription(java.lang.String keywords)
        Get a list of things that match a set of keywords from the database.
        Parameters:
        keywords - list of keywords to match.
        Returns:
        A list of things that have matching words in their description.

      • updateUser

        public void updateUser(User user)
                throws NullIDException
        Update a user that is already in the database, by using an updated User object. The user with a matching name will be updated.
        Parameters:
        user - User, matching the name of the user to be updated.
        Throws:
        NullIDException - The user has no JestID.
        See Also:
        addUser(User), removeUser(User), getUser(String)

      • updateGame

        public void updateGame(Thing thing)
                throws NullIDException
        Update a thing that is already in the database, by using an updated Thing object. The thing with a matching id will be updated.
        Parameters:
        thing - Thing, matching the id of the thing to be updated.
        Throws:
        NullIDException
        See Also:
        addGame(Thing), removeGame(Thing), getGame(String)

      • updateBid

        public void updateBid(Bid bid)
               throws NullIDException
        Throws:
        NullIDException

      • removeUser

        public void removeUser(User user)
                throws NullIDException
        Remove an exising User from the database. This only removes a user from the database, meaning any things that are owned by it must also be removed, if desired. It would be quite undesireable to leave Things and Bids with dangling references.
        Parameters:
        user - User to remove from the database.
        Throws:
        NullIDException - The user has no JestID
        See Also:
        addUser(User), updateUser(User), getUser(String), removeGame(Thing), removeBid(Bid)

      • removeUser

        public void removeUser(java.lang.String ID)

      • removeGame

        public void removeGame(Thing thing)
                throws NullIDException
        Remove an exising Thing from the database. This only removes a thing from the database, meaning any owners and borrowers should also be removed, if desired. It would be quite undesireable to leave Bids with dangling references.
        Parameters:
        thing - Thing to remove from the database.
        Throws:
        NullIDException
        See Also:
        addGame(Thing), ), removeUser(User), removeBid(Bid)

      • removeBid

        public void removeBid(Bid bid)
               throws NullIDException
        Remove an exising Bid from the database. This only removes a thing from the database, meaning any owners and borrowers should also be removed, if desired.
        Parameters:
        bid - Bid to remove from the database.
        Throws:
        NullIDException
        See Also:
        addBid(Bid), removeUser(User), removeGame(Thing)
